pull.title: GUI: init with correct display unit and update it, when user changes it via options dialog
pull.body:
- add the slot updateDisplayUnit() to overviewpage, sendcoinsdialog, sendcoinsentry and connect it to displayUnitChanged() - this ensures all fields in the GUI, who use a display unit are imediately updated, when the user changes this setting in the optionsdialog
- ensure used fields init with the current set display unit

This addresses / fixes #781 and #927.

issue.title: Overview/Recent transactions always shows BTC on startup
issue.body:
Affects 0.5.0 through 0.5.2

To reproduce:
1. Open Options, Display panel
2. Set "Unit to show amounts in" to "mBTC"; save with OK
3. Exit Bitcoin-Qt completely
4. Start Bitcoin-Qt
5. Everything remembers "mBTC" selection, except for "Recent transaction" on the "Overview" panel, which will show BTC

events.body: Updated - added `updateDisplayUnit();` in  OverviewPage::setModel(), to init the list of last transaction on the overview page with the current display unit.
@laanwj Can you take a look at the code, I think this is a rather "small" one, which could get in, if you don't want to add/change something.
Last commit implements 2 of your suggestions @laanwj , this will get squashed after we are "final" :).
Removed the ?: and int usage from the SIGNAL. Anything left?
Merged all commits, no further changes, final then.

BTW one unrelated comment regarding your commit messages. It's not very urgent, and there's no need to change it for current pulls. However, currently you try to trim everything into one line, this makes for very long "git log" lines when abbreviated. The general format that most people use for a commit message is:

```
<short description of ~50 chars>

<long description>
```

for example, see commit 1025440:

```
Added 'immature balance' for miners. Only displayed if the balance is greater than zero.

This introduces internal types:
* CKeyID: reference (hash160) of a key
* CScriptID: reference (hash160) of a script
* CTxDestination: a boost::variant of the former two

CBitcoinAddress is retrofitted to be a Base58 encoding of a
CTxDestination. This allows all internal code to only use the
internal types, and only have RPC and GUI depend on the base58 code.
(... continued ...)
```

issue.title: GUI: re-work current options dialog to a tabbed layout and use an UI-file
issue.body:
This needs a review and compilation test from a dev, but I want to ensure there is time to discuss it early!

![tabbed options page](http://i48.tinypic.com/2iw3yfb.jpg)
- re-work optionsdialog to a tabbed UI based on an ui-file / extend network options with a SOCKS version selection
- changing "Unit to show amounts in:" now also updates the unit used in the transaction fee box
- string updates
- link Apply button and OK button when enabling or disabling them (how good is a disabled Apply button, if OK saves too ^^)
- use LookupNumeric() from netbase to verify proxy address (via an EventFilter) - allows IPv6 and fixes #821
- change proxy address field to QValidatedLineEdit and add visual feedback
- add a status label used for displaying a message for invalid proxy addresses

benefits:
- much easier to expand, because it uses an UI-file, which can be edited via Qt Designer
- IPv6 support for proxy address
- SOCKS version selection

The changes to optionsdialog.cpp/.h may look weird, but I designed it from scratch and only replace the current files, to keep the naming.

events.message: add the slot updateDisplayUnit() to overviewpage, sendcoinsdialog, sendcoinsentry and connect it to displayUnitChanged() - this ensures all fields in the GUI, who use a display unit are imediately updated, when the user changes this setting in the optionsdialog / ensure used fields init with the current set display unit

events.body: @laanwj Can you merge this now, I'm working on further changes in some of the files and would like to avoid merge-conflicts :).

issue.title: Transactions amounts don't update when unit change is Apply'd
issue.body:
1. Switch to Transactions tab
2. Open Settings->Options...
3. Switch to Display tab in Options
4. Change "Unit to show amounts in" to mBTC
5. Click "Apply"
6. Observe the "Transactions" tab in the main window has not changed yet

issue.title: GUI: ensure a changed bitcoin unit immediately updates the tx list amounts
issue.body: This is kind of an addition to #1434 and fixes #1482.

comments.body:
I don't really like special-casing 0. Either;
- Keep it as "txdelegate->unit = model->getOptionsModel()->getDisplayUnit();", and remove the parameter again

or
- Pass a valid parameter everywhere you use this function, and use `txdelegate->unit = nUnit`.
Can you add braces { }, it's easy to introduce errors this way, and it looks a bit confusing with the comment

I'm not sure if I understand you, nUnit is non-zero, when updateDisplayUnit() is called via the displayUnitChanged() SIGNAL and 0 when called to init. Do you want me to use updateDisplayUnit(0) and remove the default-init of 0?
I don't want to use 0 at all, the argument adds unneeded complexity. IMO I think it's best to remove the argument nUnit completely, and always use the unit from the optionsmodel (as it was before).

We have a SLOT and SIGNAL, which handles the unit, why should we not use this? It's used in the other 2 files, too. I really like the ?: operator and disagree here. Can we find a consensus which leads to similar solutions for all 3 files edited in this pull :)?

So simply not use the int passed from fooChanged() SIGNAL... it is cleaner yes, I just was sad we didn't use it.
I'm going to change it in all 3 files.
There's ton of places where the signal argument is not used, also in Qt itself, no need to be sad about it :)
